commands.docker attach: Attach local standard input, output, and error streams to a running container
commands.docker build: Build an image from a Dockerfile
commands.docker commit: Create a new image from a container's changes
commands.docker cp: Copy files/folders between a container and the local filesystem
commands.docker deploy: Deploy a new stack or update an existing stack
commands.docker diff: Inspect changes to files or directories on a container's filesystem
commands.docker events: Get real time events from the server
commands.docker exec: Run a command in a running container
commands.docker export: Export a container's filesystem as a tar archive
commands.docker history: Show the history of an image
commands.docker import: Import the contents from a tarball to create a filesystem image
commands.docker inspect: Return low-level information on Docker objects
commands.docker kill: Kill one or more running containers
commands.docker load: Load an image from a tar archive or STDIN
commands.docker login: Log in to a Docker registry
commands.docker logout: Log out from a Docker registry
commands.docker logs: Fetch the logs of a container
commands.docker pause: Pause all processes within one or more containers
commands.docker port: List port mappings or a specific mapping for the container
commands.docker pull: Pull an image or a repository from a registry
commands.docker push: Push an image or a repository to a registry
commands.docker run: Run a command in a new container
commands.docker save: Save one or more images to a tar archive (streamed to STDOUT by default)
commands.docker search: Search the Docker Hub for images
commands.docker start: Start one or more stopped containers
commands.docker stats: Display a live stream of container(s) resource usage statistics
commands.docker stop: Stop one or more running containers
commands.docker tag: Create a tag TARGET_IMAGE that refers to SOURCE_IMAGE
commands.docker top: Display the running processes of a container
commands.docker unpause: Unpause all processes within one or more containers
commands.docker update: Update configuration of one or more containers
commands.docker wait: Block until one or more containers stop, then print their exit codes
